page.title: 06Ardross: Easter Ardross
page.content: Easter Ardross is a farm. There is an empty house and garage. Across the road is an old garage for farming equipment. There are two semi-detached and occupied houses. Down below the storage sheds are two cottages with garden sheds and a byre adjoining. There is an old farmhouse which looks like a mansion and a building for storing hay. This is one of the two large farms in the Ardross area. The people who live at the steading are nearly all 'white settlers' (people who do not belong to the area). They range from the very young to a retired group. As far as modern day comforts are concerned they are reasonably well off. Of the four groups surveyed 75% were owner occupied.
